text.content: You deal +1 damage against creatures that are Bleeding.
You deal +1 damage against creatures that are Slowed.

Your Attacks ignore Shields and 1/2 Cover, and you deal +1 damage against targets that are wielding a Shield or are behind 1/2 Cover. Additionally, you don’t have DisADV on Attacks made using the Weapon as a result of being underwater.

You deal +1 damage against the last creature you Attacked with the Weapon since the start of your last turn. Additionally, you don’t have DisADV on Attacks made using the Weapon as a result of being underwater
You deal +1 damage against creatures that are Grappled. Additionally, a Fist Weapon is considered to be a free hand when Grappling.
You deal +1 damage against creatures that are Dazed or Petrified.
You deal +1 damage against creatures that are Impaired.

You deal +1 damage against a creature if you moved 2 Spaces towards it immediately before making the Attack or if it’s on a Mount. Additionally, you don’t have DisADV on Attack Checks made using the Weapon as a result of being underwater.
You deal +1 damage against creatures that are Hindered.
You deal +1 damage against creatures that are Exposed.
You deal +1 damage against creatures that are farther than 1 Space from you.
This Weapon requires ammunition to make Attacks. You can load a Weapon as part of an Attack made with it.
Drawing the Weapon doesn’t provoke Opportunity Attacks. If you draw the Weapon as part of an Attack, you have ADV on the Attack. You can only gain this benefit once against each creature per Combat.
You gain +1PD while wielding the Weapon.
The Weapon’s damage increases by 1.
You deal +1 damage on Heavy Hits.
Your Range increases to 30/90.
The Weapon gains a second Weapon Style. When you make an Attack with the Weapon, you must choose which Weapon Style to use. The chosen Weapon Style determines the Attack’s damage type.
This Weapon adds 1 Space to your Melee Range when you Attack with it.

The Weapon’s damage increases by 1, but you must spend1 APand use a free hand to reload the Weapon.

If you make a Ranged Attack with the Weapon using a Reaction, the Weapon must already be loaded to perform the Attack.

When you make a Ranged Attack with the Weapon while Hidden, you remain Unheard by creatures you’re Hidden from.

You must be both Unseen and Unheard to be Hidden. If you become seen while making the Attack, you’re no longer Hidden.
You can throw the Weapon to make a Ranged Martial Attack (5/10).
You can throw the Weapon to make a Ranged Martial Attack (10/20).
The Weapon requires 2 hands when you Attack with it.

You have DisADV on Attacks made with the Weapon against targets within 1 Space of you.

The DisADV from Unwieldy stacks with the DisADV that Ranged Weapons get when used to make Attacks when an enemy is within 1 Space of you (making it DisADV 2).
This Weapon can be wielded with 1 or 2 hands. When you wield the Weapon with 2 hands, you gain a +2 bonus to Hit using it.
When you Miss a Ranged Attack with the Weapon, it returns to your hand.

When you Attack with this Weapon, you instead make a Martial Check contested by the target’s Physical Save.

Success:The target is Grappled by the weapon until it’s freed. Forced movement doesn't end the Grapple, but teleportation does.

Success (10): The target is also Restrained until it’s freed. A creature can spend 1 AP to make a DC 10 Might Check.

  • Success:It can free itself or another creature within its reach.

Dealing 1 Slashing damage to the Weapon (PD 10) ends the effect and breaks it, freeing the creature without harming it. A Weapon with this property deals1less damage. This Property has no effect on creatures that are formless, smaller than Small, or bigger than Large.
